content: 2002 Hong Kong-Singaporean film by John D. Lamond ***True Files*** (also known as ***Shanghai Lilly***) is a 2002 film directed by [John D. Lamond](/wiki/John_D._Lamond) and starring [Sam Bottoms](/wiki/Sam_Bottoms), [Lim Kay Tong](/wiki/Lim_Kay_Tong), Leah Di Stasio, and [Glory Annen](/wiki/Glory_Annen_Clibbery). The film was shot in 1997 in a backlot in Singapore. The film languished in legal limbo for a time after one of the financiers suffered a stroke but Lamond managed to sell it to 10 territories, mostly in Asia. ## Plot In [Asia](/wiki/Asia), 1936, an American woman's husband is shot while sleeping with a [prostitute](/wiki/Prostitution). - *True Files* at [IMDb](/wiki/IMDb_(identifier)) This article related to a Singaporean film is a stub.
